comments.body: I'm not too worried about getting something from Dropbox, but could you add some comments on how this OpenBLAS was built and who has access to that Dropbox folder? Or a link to those details?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +31,35 @@  # built on GCC compile farm machine named gcc112
  # manually uploaded tarball to an unshared Dropbox location
  wget -O openblas-power8.tar.gz https://www.dropbox.com/s/zcwhk7c2zptwy0s/openblas-v0.3.5-ppc64le-power8.tar.gz?dl=0
  tar zxvf openblas-power8.tar.gz
  sudo cp -r ./64/lib/* /usr/lib

comments.body: could remove these two lines -- debug mostly -- relocation to fix path issue relative to master

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +8,12 @@if [ -n "$PPC64_LE" ]; then
  pwd
  ls -ltrh
  target=$(python tools/openblas_support.py)
  sudo cp -r $target/64/lib/* /usr/lib

comments.body: Which run fails without this line?
One or more of the `setup.py` installs... I think.  Let's find out...

Actually, all the non-pip installs should fail, because travis-test.sh doesn't explicitly install cython.  The pip installs of numpy should work, because pip reads pyproject.toml and does a "private" install of the build requirements that it finds there.
The two jobs that set `USE_WHEEL=1` and the one that sets `USE_DEBUG=1` fail to build numpy, because they build numpy by running `setup.py`, but cython is not installed.
Maybe add that to the comment: `version requirement stored there.` -> `version requirement for the USE_WHEEL=1 and USE_DEBUG=1 builds.`

Yeah, I can change that comment to be clearer.

The *version requirement* is for any build of numpy, not just those that set `USE_WHEEL` or `USE_DEBUG`.  I put that comment there as an attempt to explain why I get the cython package argument from `test_requirements.txt` instead of just writing

    pip install setuptools wheel cython

I'll work on better wording.

Even better would be to read the build requirements directly from pyproject.toml.  I had that in an earlier version of this PR, but I got the sense that it seemed too complicated.

(Unfortunately, we currently have the required version of cython hard-coded in three places: pyproject.toml, test_requirements.txt, and tools/cythonize.py.  Not sure it is worth the effort at the moment to fix that; even if it is, it can probably wait for a different PR.)
I updated the comments.  Tests are running again...

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +50,54 @@# writing 'pip install setuptools wheel cython'.
pip install setuptools wheel `grep cython test_requirements.txt`

if [ -n "$USE_ASV" ]; then pip install asv; fi
